update.description:
Improvements include:

1. Better look and feel
1. Removed some spurious documentation, such as private headers.
1. Added a few descriptions for modules.

There is still a lot more we can do, but I didn't want to make too many changes. 


[Link to the current documentation](http://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com/gazebo/api/dev/index.html)
update.title: Doxygen update

content.raw: I just addressed most of the files, except `gazebo/physics/AdiabaticAtmosphere.hh` and `gazebo/physics/AtmosphereFactory.cc` which do not exist in gazebo7.
content.html: I just addressed most of the files, except gazebo/physics/AdiabaticAtmosphere.hh and gazebo/physics/AtmosphereFactory.cc which do not exist in gazebo7.

update.title: Doxygen update

content.raw: Good point. I'll take a look.
I see `ConnectionPrivate`, `EventPrivate` and `EventTPrivate`. All this classes live in `Event.hh` and `EventTPrivate` is templated.
content.html: I see ConnectionPrivate, EventPrivate and EventTPrivate. All this classes live in Event.hh and EventTPrivate is templated.

content.raw: `.cc` files shouldn't be processed. Do you have an example of where a Private class is showing up in the documentation?
content.html: .cc files shouldn't be processed. Do you have an example of where a Private class is showing up in the documentation?

content.raw: How about adding here `*Private`? There are some private classes that live in regular `.cc` files without the `Private` suffix (check the class list and look for `private`).
content.html: How about adding here *Private? There are some private classes that live in regular .cc files without the Private suffix (check the class list and look for private).

content.raw: Oh, I was looking at the link provided in the description. I'm generating my doc locally to compare now...
content.html: Oh, I was looking at the link provided in the description. I'm generating my doc locally to compare now...

content.raw: Where should I see this message in the generated documentation?
content.html: Where should I see this message in the generated documentation?

content.raw: I see physics docs about bullet, dart, and simbody, but nothing about ODE. I'll try to see why ODE is treated differently.
content.html: I see physics docs about bullet, dart, and simbody, but nothing about ODE. I'll try to see why ODE is treated differently.

update.description:
Improvements include:

1. Better look and feel
1. Removed some spurious documentation, such as private headers.
1. Added a few descriptions for modules.

There is still a lot more we can do, but I didn't want to make too many changes. 


[Link to the current documentation](http://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com/gazebo/api/dev/index.html)
update.title: Doxygen update

content.raw:
Ahh, I was unclear. The length of a of the whole list of member functions for a class is increased. Basically, more scrolling is required to browse the list of functions for a class. Take a look at the Actor class for example.

I'll put the briefs back in. Scrolling seems like a small price to pay for the briefs.
content.html:
Ahh, I was unclear. The length of a of the whole list of member functions for a class is increased. Basically, more scrolling is required to browse the list of functions for a class. Take a look at the Actor class for example.

I'll put the briefs back in. Scrolling seems like a small price to pay for the briefs.

content.raw: Maybe I was looking at the wrong file, but I didn't see any outrageously sized `\brief` strings. Which ones are big?
content.html: Maybe I was looking at the wrong file, but I didn't see any outrageously sized \brief strings. Which ones are big?

content.raw:
We could go either way. I removed it for the sake of conciseness, but I'm not married to the change.

If we put it back in, then all class functions will have abbreviated briefs as well. For some classes, this can dramatically increase the size of the function listing.

Try changing `BRIEF_MEMBER_DESC` to `Yes` in `gazebo.in` to see what it's like with briefs.
content.html:
We could go either way. I removed it for the sake of conciseness, but I'm not married to the change.

If we put it back in, then all class functions will have abbreviated briefs as well. For some classes, this can dramatically increase the size of the function listing.

Try changing BRIEF_MEMBER_DESC to Yes in gazebo.in to see what it's like with briefs.

content.raw: The new style is nice. I kinda like that the existing docs show a brief summary of each class on the [class listing page](http://osrf-distributions.s3.amazonaws.com/gazebo/api/dev/group__gazebo__physics.html). That seems to be missing in the new docs that I just generated for testing.
content.html: The new style is nice. I kinda like that the existing docs show a brief summary of each class on the class listing page. That seems to be missing in the new docs that I just generated for testing.
